A

actionPerformed(ActionEvent) - Method in class GameController
Callback used when the user clicks a button (reset, quit, settings, undo or redo)
addStates() - Method in class GameController
addStates is a helper method that pushes every GameModel into the undo stack
allDotsNotCaptured() - Method in class GameModel
allDotsNotCaptured is a helper method that checks if all dots on the board are not captured.

B

board - Variable in class GameView
The board is a two dimensionnal array of DotButtons instances

C

canRedo() - Method in class GameController
canRedo is a helper method that returns true if the user can redo and false otherwise.
canUndo() - Method in class GameController
canUndo is a helper method that returns true if the user can undo and false otherwise.

Sets the status of the dot at coordinate (i,j) to captured

Is that location captured ?

Clears the stack (stack is now empty)

The method clones the current GameModel and returns the copy.

DotButton - Class in <Unnamed>
In the application FlodIt, a DotButton is a specialized color of JButton that represents a dot in the game.

Constructor used for initializing a cell of a specified color.
DotButton(int, int) - Constructor for class DotButton
 
DotInfo - Class in <Unnamed>
The class DotInfo is a simple helper class to store the initial color and state (captured or not) at the dot position (x,y)
